title: Task 1: Attribute a work of art to a specific artist
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response. Each point is earned independently.
descriptions: Response does not correctly attribute the work shown to the cultural tradition in which it was created.
Response correctly attributes the work shown to the cultural tradition in which it was created.

title: Task 2: Justify an attribution of a work of art by explaining similarities with work by a specific artist
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response. Each point is earned independently.
descriptions: Response does not accurately use specific visual evidence to justify the attribution by describing a relevant similarity between the work shown and other work from the same tradition.
Response accurately uses specific visual evidence to justify the attribution by describing one relevant similarity between the work shown and other work from the same tradition.
Response accurately uses specific visual evidence to justify the attribution by describing two relevant similarities between the work shown and other work from the same tradition.

title: Task 3: Explain how the possible intent, purpose, and/or function shape the creation or meaning of a work of art
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response. Each point is earned independently.
descriptions: Response does not accurately use an example of specific evidence to explain how the design of the work was influenced by its specific function and/or religious context.
Response accurately uses one example of specific evidence to explain how the design of the work was influenced by its specific function and/or religious context.
Response accurately uses two examples of specific evidence to explain how the design of the work was influenced by its specific function and/or religious context.
